TopicTitle: What is your favorite stock engine?

Articles.Content:
Only stock engines, please.

Personally I love the LV-909 "Terrier":

Poodle, extremely ugly but the most useful engine IMO.

Edit: maybe add a poll ? There are few enough stock engines to fit in a poll I think.

Edited October 11, 2015 by Gaarst

Poodle, extremely ugly but the most useful engine IMO.

Edit: maybe add a poll ? There are few enough stock engines to fit in a poll I think.

No, there are 18 stock rocket engines, plus 2 jets.
18 ? Never realised there were so much !
Skipper, probably.

When the new aerospike is out, that will probably be my favourite.

Until then, I have to say the Poodle, as well.

Happy landings!

ETA: And yes, the Skipper is a great engine as well.

Yeah, there are a lot of engines. 2 size 0 rocket engines, 3 size 1 (LV series) rocket engines, 3 size 2 (Rockomax) rocket engines, 2 size 3 (Kerbodyne) rocket engines, 3 radial rocket engines, the nuclear engine, the rapier engine, the ion engine, the monopropellant engine, 1 LFB, 5 SRBs (including the sepratron) and 2 jet engines. Arguably also the escape tower and RCS ports. And then there's going to be at least two more in 1.1 1.0.5

EDIT: Oh, and the aerospike. I knew I'd missed something.

I like the RT-10 because stacking them and using explosive staging is always fun.

Edited October 12, 2015 by TheMoonRover
Skipper, it's the best sustainer engine for most of the rockets I make.
I'd say the LV-T45, RAPIER, NERVA, or LV-909. I love all of them. Even if the LV-T45 isn't very good.
:)Ant. Funny exhaust but still useful engine. This is even my mostly-used payload engine (although largely because most of my in-flight probes are small satellites)
Have to say Skipper because of its capabilities. For me, its a must have on LKO Orbital Modules.

Mines the good old LV-T30 Reliant, gets my Kerbals off the ground without that annoying shaking

Gimbal? Training wheel more like!
The King is dead, long live the King!

My favorite is the Spark. It's a low powered engine with so many uses. I have used it in my LM replicas (notably as the ascent stage), and also, I love it because it's so efficient. I can slap the smallest 1m fuel tank and with the Spark that's like 2km/s of DV. It's under credited, I don't see anyone using it, yet it has so many uses!

On a side note, the aerospike is the WORST engine. It sure has good efficiency, but it's almost as heavy as the nuclear engine!! Moreover, it doesn't gimbal making flight harder on a rocket. Lastly, it has NO BOTTOM NODE, ie, you can't put anything under the engine!! I read the wiki about it and the idea is that it's a space plane specific engine, but I still find it a crappy excuse. The RAPIER has a bottom attachment node, why not the aerospike? The aerospike would be my second favorite if it was slightly lighter and could decouple. End of rant.
The Q-10 is really good in Mun landers and for those precise adjustments while docking.

When the new aerospike is out, that will probably be my favourite.

Until then, I have to say the Poodle, as well.

Happy landings!

ETA: And yes, the Skipper is a great engine as well.

Wait, what new aerospike?

*looks stuff up*

THE HYPE IS REAL.

I use the Rhino engine way too much. Maybe that's my favorite, but it's hard to tell, since they're all useful for different purposes.

- - - Updated - - -

Oh, the new aerospike coming in 1.0.5 has a bottom attachment node.

Thank Jeb!
I will always love the 909. Long live the 909! WILL ALWAYS LOVE (caps)
I'm really liking the thud at the moment for thos Duna landers

Have to love the kicker (SRB). Started with way too much reliance on RT-10 ("can of boom") but economics, nerfs, and the general usefulness of the kicker pushed it ahead. It probably remains even after the post 1.0.x nerfs to SRBs.

Yes, it counts. Just look under the engine tab and you will find all the SRBs.
While I have a soft spot in my heart for the Swivel, The Mainsail is what I use when stuff needs to get done. My entire space program is designed around that engine.

48-7S "Spark". Very good for delta v for anything less than 4 tonnes. Although, I love the "Dawn" as well. For bigger rockets, I love the "Aerospike." It just looks really cool and mostly efficient, but I like the looks more than anything.
Ion and Mainsail.
Skipper.
How can you pick just one, they all serve different functions. I use almost all of them.
